title: Nokia 's net sales 1999 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Net sales in billion euros, with a total of 21 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2016 to 2010.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2019 to 2016.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2010 to 2007.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2007 to 2004.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2004 to 2001.
gold: In 2018 , Nokia had 22.5 billion euros in net sales , which is a small decrease from the year before . In the past decade , the company has made several directional shifts from handheld devices to network infrastructure in order to keep up with the quickly evolving electronics and telecommunications industry . Focus on B2B markets and products After selling its mobile and devices segment to Microsoft in 2014 , Nokia has focused on its network infrastructure business .
